etymology.interpretation: Combines the wood element to signal a meaning related to trees or timber, while 凡 supplies the fán pronunciation. The presence of two wood components evokes small branches or brushwood, matching the sense of twigs and undergrowth.

examples.chinese: 他的名字里有个少见的字“棥”(他的名字裡有個少見的字「棥」)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de míngzi lǐ yǒu gè shǎojiàn de zì “fán”.
examples.english: There is a rare character, “棥,” in his name.

examples.chinese: 一些地方志或碑刻上能见到“棥”字，用在地名里(一些地方志或碑刻上能見到「棥」字，用在地名裡)。
examples.pinyin: Yīxiē dìfāngzhì huò bēikè shàng néng jiàndào “fán” zì, yòng zài dìmíng lǐ.
examples.english: In some local gazetteers or inscriptions, the character “棥” appears in place names.

examples.chinese: 研究者在整理文献时会标注“棥”为生僻字(研究者在整理文獻時會標註「棥」為生僻字)。
examples.pinyin: Yánjiūzhě zài zhěnglǐ wénxiàn shí huì biāozhù “fán” wéi shēngpì zì.
examples.english: Researchers mark “棥” as an obscure character when editing documents.
